SEARCH
Package edu.uw.pce.advjava.services

Interface TriggeredDispatcher<E,T>

Type Parameters:
E - the type held by the queue.
T - the dispatch threshold type.
public interface TriggeredDispatcher<E,T>
A priority queue, with the additional semantics of a dispatch threshold. Only dispatchable elements, elements that meet the dispatch threshold, may be dequeued. Dispatchable elements are elements that meet some externally defined criteria in addition to being at the top of the queue. TriggeredDispatcher is configured with a dispatch filter, upon construction, the dispatch filter will implement the dispatch criteria. and is of type BiPredicate<T,E>.
See Also:
  • BiPredicate

  • Method Details

    • enqueue

      void enqueue(E e)
      Adds the specified element to the queue. After adding the order dispatches any dispatchable orders.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to be added to the queue

    • dequeue

      E dequeue()
      Removes the first dispatchable element in the queue. If the queue is empty or there are elements in the queue, but they do not meet the dispatch threshold null will be returned.
      Returns:
      the first dispatchable element in the queue, or null if there are no dispatchable elements in the queue

    • peek

      E peek()
      Returns the first element in the queue.
      Returns:
      the first element in the queue, or null if the queue is empty

    • setDispatchAction

      void setDispatchAction(Consumer<? super E> consumer)
      Registers the consumer to be process dispatchable items in the queue.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the consumer to be registered

    • setThreshold

      void setThreshold(T threshold)
      Adjusts the threshold and subsequently dispatches any dispatchable orders.
      Parameters:
      threshold - - the new threshold

    • getThreshold

      T getThreshold()
      Obtains the current threshold value.
      Returns:
      the current threshold

    • size

      int size()
      Returns the number of elements currently in the queue.
      Returns:
      the number of elements currently in the queue.
